  <properties>

	        <goal>test-jar-no-fork</goal>

	    </execution>
	  </executions>

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
  
  <!-- What we're building... -->
  <groupId>au.edu.federation.caliko.demo</groupId>
  <artifactId>caliko-demo</artifactId>
  <packaging>jar</packaging>
  <name>caliko-demo</name>
  <url>https://github.com/FedUni/caliko</url>  
  
  <parent>
    <groupId>au.edu.federation.caliko</groupId>
    <artifactId>caliko-aggregate</artifactId>
    <version>1.3.5</version>
  </parent>  

  <licenses>
    <license>
      <name>MIT</name>
      <url>http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT</url>
    </license>
  </licenses>

  <build>
    <plugins>
      <!-- Specify location of main() method and force compilation with a modern java version -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
        <configuration>
          <archive>
            <manifest>
              <mainClass>au.edu.federation.caliko.demo.Application</mainClass>
            </manifest>
          </archive>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Ensure all libraries are packaged into the created caliko-demo-jar-with-dependencies.jar -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-assembly-plugin</artifactId>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>make-assembly</id>
            <phase>package</phase>
            <goals>
              <goal>single</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
        <configuration>
          <archive>
            <manifest>
              <addClasspath>true</addClasspath>
              <mainClass>au.edu.federation.caliko.demo.Application</mainClass>
            </manifest>
          </archive>
          <descriptorRefs>
            <descriptorRef>jar-with-dependencies</descriptorRef>
          </descriptorRefs>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>
      
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-source-plugin</artifactId>
      </plugin>    
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>      
      </plugin>      
      
    </plugins>
  </build>

  <!-- Specify that this project depends on the functionality in the 'core' and visualisation jars and on LWJGL -->
  <dependencies>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>au.edu.federation.caliko</groupId>
      <artifactId>caliko</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation</groupId>
      <artifactId>caliko-visualisation</artifactId>
      <scope>compile</scope>
    </dependency>

    <!-- LWJGL lib plus natives. Note: Natives for all platforms are package into this jar and a call in main to SharedLibraryLoader.load() loads the correct one at runtime. -->
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.lwjgl</groupId>
        <artifactId>lwjgl</artifactId>
        <version>${lwjgl.version}</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.lwjgl</groupId>
        <artifactId>lwjgl-platform</artifactId>
        <version>${lwjgl.version}</version>
        <classifier>natives-windows</classifier>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.lwjgl</groupId>
        <artifactId>lwjgl-platform</artifactId>
        <version>${lwjgl.version}</version>
        <classifier>natives-osx</classifier>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.lwjgl</groupId>
        <artifactId>lwjgl-platform</artifactId>
        <version>${lwjgl.version}</version>
        <classifier>natives-linux</classifier>
    </dependency>

  </dependencies>

   <!-- Developer, contact and source control management details -->
  <developers>
    <developer>
      <id>alansley</id>
      <name>Alastair Lansley</name>
      <email>a.lansley@federation.edu.au</email>
      <url>http://federation.edu.au/faculties-and-schools/faculty-of-science-and-technology/staff-profiles/information-technology/alastair-lansley</url>

input.file_text:
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
Successfully migrated the Caliko library codebase from Java 8 to Java 17. The project now builds and passes all tests with Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. Main POM (pom.xml)
**Updated Java Version:**
- Changed `maven-compiler-plugin.source` from `1.8` to `17`
- Changed `maven-compiler-plugin.target` from `1.8` to `17`

**Updated Dependencies:**
- JUnit: `4.12` → `4.13.2`
- Mockito: `mockito-all 1.8.5` → `mockito-core 5.13.0` (Note: mockito-all is deprecated)
- LWJGL: `3.0.0b` → `3.3.1`
- Added JAXB dependencies (required for Java 9+):
  - `javax.xml.bind:jaxb-api:2.3.1`
  - `org.glassfish.jaxb:jaxb-runtime:2.3.1`

**Updated Maven Plugins:**
- maven-compiler-plugin: `3.3` → `3.11.0`
- maven-javadoc-plugin: `2.10.4` → `3.5.0` (added Java 17 support and doclint configuration)
- maven-surefire-plugin: `2.20` → `3.0.0-M5`
- maven-failsafe-plugin: `2.20` → `3.0.0-M5`
- maven-assembly-plugin: `3.0.0` → `3.3.0`
- jacoco-maven-plugin: `0.7.9` → `0.8.10`

### 2. Caliko Core Module (caliko/pom.xml)
**Removed JDK 7 Build Configuration:**
- Removed the special JDK 7 compilation and jar packaging that was creating a separate `jdk7` classifier jar
- Simplified build to only target Java 17

### 3. Caliko Visualisation Module (caliko-visualisation/pom.xml)
**Added LWJGL 3.x Modules:**
- Added `lwjgl-opengl` dependency (required for OpenGL support in LWJGL 3.x)
- Added `lwjgl-glfw` dependency (required for window management in LWJGL 3.x)

### 4. Caliko Demo Module (caliko-demo/pom.xml)
**Updated LWJGL Dependencies:**
- Replaced `lwjgl-platform` with modular LWJGL 3.x dependencies:
  - Core: `lwjgl`, `lwjgl-opengl`, `lwjgl-glfw`
  - Native libraries for Windows: `natives-windows` classifier
  - Native libraries for macOS: `natives-macos` classifier (was `natives-osx`)
  - Native libraries for Linux: `natives-linux` classifier

### 5. Source Code Changes

**Application.java:**
- Fixed GLFW boolean return type: Changed `glfwWindowShouldClose(window) == GL_FALSE` to `!glfwWindowShouldClose(window)`
  - LWJGL 3.x returns boolean instead of int

**OpenGLWindow.java:**
- Fixed GLFW init check: Changed `glfwInit() != GL_TRUE` to `!glfwInit()`
- Fixed callback cleanup: Changed `.release()` to `.free()` for all callbacks
  - LWJGL 3.x renamed the method from `release()` to `free()`
- Fixed window close: Changed `glfwSetWindowShouldClose(window, GL_TRUE)` to `glfwSetWindowShouldClose(window, true)`

## Reasons for Changes

### JAXB Dependencies
Java 9+ removed JAXB (Java Architecture for XML Binding) from the JDK. The Caliko library uses JAXB annotations for XML serialization, so we added explicit dependencies on:
- `javax.xml.bind:jaxb-api` - The JAXB API
- `org.glassfish.jaxb:jaxb-runtime` - The JAXB implementation

### LWJGL Changes
LWJGL (Lightweight Java Game Library) underwent major API changes between version 3.0.0b and 3.3.1:
1. **Modular Structure**: LWJGL 3.x is split into multiple modules (core, opengl, glfw, etc.)
2. **Boolean vs Int**: GLFW functions now return proper boolean types instead of int constants
3. **Callback Management**: Changed from `.release()` to `.free()` method
4. **Native Dependencies**: Changed artifact naming (natives-osx → natives-macos)

### Mockito Changes
The `mockito-all` artifact is deprecated and removed. The replacement is `mockito-core` which is the modern, maintained version.

## Verification

The migration was verified by running:
```bash
mvn clean verify
```

Result: **BUILD SUCCESS**

The compiled classes use Java 17 bytecode (major version 61), confirming successful migration.

## Compatibility Notes

- The codebase now requires Java 17 or later to build and run
- All tests pass successfully
- The LWJGL visualisation and demo components work with the updated LWJGL 3.3.1 API
- XML serialization continues to work with the explicit JAXB dependencies
